titles: An elegy on the truly honourable, and most virtuous, charitable, and pious lady, Countesse of Devonshire, vvho lately departed this life, being a hundred and odd years of age, whose corps now lies in deserved state in Holbourn.
notes: Verse: "Are all the poets dumb? And is there none ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Devonshire, Christiana Cavendish, --  Countess of, d. 1675 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
